intro: Quercus mirbeckii, commonly known as the Mirbeck oak, is a species of evergreen oak native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are typically elliptical in shape and have a dark green upper surface. The tree produces small, reddish-brown acorns that are enclosed in a cupule, a unique feature among oaks. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to the island's harsh climate. The Mirbeck oak plays an important ecological role in the unique ecosystems of the Canary Islands.
